OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(3) WIIFM: Business and Organization Value

As business or organization leader
I want well-defined and usable digital interfaces for partners and the public
so that I can more easily change and scale my value streams.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(4) WIIFM: API Developers

As an API developer
I want to describe the product I am going to implement
so that I can use various tools throughout the API lifecycle.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(5) WIIFM: API Consumers

As an API consumer
I want APIs to have standardized descriptions
so that I can easily understand and consume the products I am accessing.


OpenAPI User Stories Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(6) WIIFM: Platform People

As an API platform person
I want to support standardized description formats
so that all producers and consumers speak the same language.

(8) What AI Needs?



APIs for AI Consumers Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(9) OpenAPI: A Robust Foundation

Feature Enables
Paths, operations, schemas Machine-readable contract
Parameters & examples Additional interaction details
Tags & grouping Basic categorization
Security schemes Authentication and authorization setup
External docs Human-oriented documentation
Links Basic flow hints (since OpenAPI 3.0)


APIs for AI Consumers Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(10) What AI Needs

  • Intent & purpose
  • Typical usage sequences
  • Side effect awareness
  • Outcome semantics
  • Selection & ranking signals


APIs for AI Consumers Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(11) AI Gaps of OpenAPI

AI Consumer Need OpenAPI Gap
Intent & purpose Why this API exists; goal or outcome it supports
Sequence & flow Full workflows, ordering, next-best-call
Side effects & safety Whether an operation is safe, idempotent, retryable
Semantic meaning Business-level category, tags, or ontology references
Selection & ranking Signals for priority, deprecation, usage patterns


APIs for AI Consumers Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(12) Extending OpenAPI or Layering?

  • OpenAPI Extensions
    • + Compatible with existing OpenAPI tooling
    • + Allows incremental enrichment without new stack
    • – Can become fragmented or inconsistent
    • – Limited expressiveness for intent and workflows
  • Higher-Level Layer on Top
    • + Tailored to AI agent goals and interaction models
    • + Enables richer representations: workflows, outcomes, priorities
    • – Requires new tooling or transformation logic
    • – Introduces more complexity and coordination effort


APIs for AI Consumers Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(13) AI Maturity Starts with Asking the Right Questions

  • We don't yet have a standard for AI-ready API metadata
  • But teams can start assessing APIs today
    • Is the API's purpose clear?
    • Are typical usage flows documented?
    • Is behavior like retries or side effects explicit?
    • Can others understand and use it without extra help?
  • Even informal answers help shape future strategy
  • Be ready to re-assess and refactor


AI-based APIs

Outline (AI-based APIs)

  1. OpenAPI User Stories [4]
  2. APIs for AI Consumers [6]
  3. AI-based APIs [3]
  4. Conclusions [2]
AI-based APIs Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(15) What AI Consumers Might Want to Know

  • Does this API use AI at runtime?
  • Is the result deterministic or variable?
  • Which model is used and can I choose it?
  • Will my input be stored or used for training?
  • Can I influence or opt out of that behavior?


AI-based APIs Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(16) Toward a Shared Extension for AI Metadata

  • Expose key AI characteristics through OpenAPI extensions
  • Examples: model used, input retention, override options
  • Avoid vendor lock-in by aligning on community patterns
  • Start simple — evolve format over time as consensus grows


AI-based APIs Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(17) Add Metadata Flexibly with OpenAPI Overlays

  • Overlays let you patch OpenAPI docs without changing the base
  • Ideal for injecting runtime or environment-specific metadata
  • Enables layering AI disclosures per deployment or audience
  • Part of the OpenAPI Initiative — ready to be used today

Conclusions Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(19) Shaping the Future Together — via the OpenAPI Initiative

  • We've talked about descriptions, transparency, and standards
  • The OpenAPI Initiative is where this work happens
  • Follow the OAI, contribute ideas, join the conversation
  • If this is strategic for you — consider becoming a member [https://www.openapis.org/membershipmembers]
  • More alignment means better tools, stronger APIs, and faster progress


Conclusions Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Summit Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI
